spanishExample: ¡Trátalo mejor! Solo tiene veinticinco años.
englishTranslation: Treat him better! He’s only twenty-five.
vocabIncluded: tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)

spanishExample: Acaba de tener el puesto que quería.
englishTranslation: She just had the position she wanted.
vocabIncluded: acaba: finishes, he/she/it finishes (Acabar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Acabamos de ir al frente de la casa.
englishTranslation: We just went to the front of the house.
vocabIncluded: acabamos: finish, we finish (Acabar, present, 1st person plural)
al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Acaban de pasar su fin de semana en el oeste.
englishTranslation: They just passed their weekend in the west.
vocabIncluded: acaban: finish, they finish (Acabar, present, 3rd person plural)
fin de semana: weekend / end of week (idiom)

spanishExample: Acabas de ir al oeste.
englishTranslation: You just went to the west.
vocabIncluded: acabas: finish, you finish (Acabar, present, 2nd person)
al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Acabo de ir al lugar que está a la vuelta de la esquina.
englishTranslation: I just went to the place that is around the corner.
vocabIncluded: acabo: finish, I finish (Acabar, present, 1st person)
al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: El grupo está atrás de la línea, hacia el este, no hacia el sur.
englishTranslation: The group is behind the line, toward the east, not toward the south.
vocabIncluded: atrás: back/backwards (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: El libro se trataba de veintiuna personas.
englishTranslation: The book was about twenty-one people.
vocabIncluded: trataba: tried, he/she/it tried (Tratar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Está en el frente de la fila.
englishTranslation: She is in the front of the queue.

spanishExample: Estaba en el centro del grupo.
englishTranslation: He was in the center of the group.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Ha tratado de ir al sur, pero necesita ir al este.
englishTranslation: She has tried to go to the south, but she needs to go to the east.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Hay una línea que va del norte al sur.
englishTranslation: There is a line that goes from north to south.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: La fila está en la esquina.
englishTranslation: The queue is at the corner.

spanishExample: Lo trato así porque tiene veintidós años.
englishTranslation: I treat him like this because he is twenty-two years old.
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)
trato: try, I try (Tratar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Me trata como un niño, pero tengo veintiocho años.
englishTranslation: She treats me like a kid, but I’m twenty-eight years old.
vocabIncluded: tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)
trata: tries, he/she/it tries (Tratar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No le gusta estar en línea, aunque tiene veintiséis años.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t like being online, even though he’s twenty-six.
vocabIncluded: gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)

spanishExample: No te preocupes por tu edad, el puesto está a la vuelta de la esquina.
englishTranslation: Don’t worry about your age, the position is around the corner.
vocabIncluded: preocuparse: any use of to worry with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to be worried)

spanishExample: Se acabó la comida.
englishTranslation: The food ran out.
vocabIncluded: acabarse: any use of acabar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to run out)
acabó: finished, he/she/it finished (Acabar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si me tratas así, se acabará nuestro trabajo.
englishTranslation: If you treat me like this, our work will run out.
vocabIncluded: acabarse: any use of acabar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to run out)
acabará: will finish, he/she/it will finish (Acabar, future, 3rd person)
así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
tratas: try, you try (Tratar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Si vas a esa esquina, irás hacia el norte.
englishTranslation: If you go to that corner, you’ll go north.
vocabIncluded: irás: "will go", "you will go" (Ir, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Siempre lo trataba como el centro del mundo.
englishTranslation: I always treated him as the center of the world.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
trataba: tried, he/she/it tried (Tratar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tiene que acabar su trabajo.
englishTranslation: She has to finish her job.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Tiene veinticuatro años de edad y le gusta estar en línea.
englishTranslation: He is twenty-four years of age and he likes to be online.
vocabIncluded: gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)

spanishExample: Tienes que tratar de ir al este.
englishTranslation: You have to try to go to the east.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun
de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Traté de darle este libro que se trata de la guerra.
englishTranslation: I tried to give her this book that’s about the war.
vocabIncluded: de used after Tratar to mean “try to”
trata: tries, he/she/it tries (Tratar, present, 3rd person)
traté: tried, I tried (Tratar, preterite, 1st person)
